SEARCH
Package jdbc

Class mysqlConnection

java.lang.Object
jdbc.mysqlConnection
public class mysqlConnection extends Object
This class provides database-related utility methods for managing BPARK system data, such as subscribers, reservations, parking spots, and active parkings. Instead of directly managing connections in every method, the class uses a helper class called DBExecutor, which encapsulates the connection management logic. How it works: - Each database operation is executed using a lambda expression that receives an open Connection object. - The DBExecutor.execute(...) method ensures the connection is automatically obtained from the connection pool, used, and then returned safely. - This eliminates repetitive boilerplate code such as: opening a connection, handling exceptions, and closing resources. - The lambda body focuses only on what the query does – not how to manage the connection. Benefits of this approach: - Code is shorter and easier to read. - Reduces the chance of forgetting to close connections. - Promotes cleaner separation of concerns – logic vs. resource management. - Uses Java functional programming to simplify repetitive patterns.

  • Method Details

    • connectToDB

      public static Connection connectToDB()
      Retrieves a database connection from the connection pool. This method delegates the request to the ConnectionPool singleton, which manages a pool of reusable database connections for efficiency and performance.
      Returns:
      a Connection object ready for database operations, or null if the pool fails to provide a connection

    • doesSubscriberExist

      public static boolean doesSubscriberExist(String idNumber)
      Checks if a subscriber with the given ID number already exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      idNumber - The subscriber's ID number.
      Returns:
      true if the subscriber exists, false otherwise.

    • registerSubscriber

      public static boolean registerSubscriber(String firstName, String lastName, String idNumber, String email, String phone, String vehicleNumber1, String creditCard)
      Registers a new subscriber in the database with the given details.
      Returns:
      true if the insertion was successful, false otherwise.

    • getSubscriberInfo

      public static String getSubscriberInfo(String subscriberId)
      Retrieves subscriber information from the database based on the given subscriber ID. Builds a formatted string containing all relevant subscriber fields if found. If the subscriber does not exist, returns a message indicating so. In case of a database access error, returns an error message and logs the stack trace.
      Parameters:
      subscriberId - The ID of the subscriber to look up.
      Returns:
      A formatted string with subscriber details or an error message.

    • getSubscriberById

      public static Subscriber getSubscriberById(String id)
      Retrieves subscriber information from the database using a subscriber ID. This method queries the subscribers table and constructs a Subscriber object with all relevant fields if a matching record is found. If no record is found or an error occurs, the method returns null.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the subscriber to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A Subscriber object containing the subscriber’s details, or null if no such subscriber exists or an exception occurred.

    • updateSubscriberContactInfo

      public static boolean updateSubscriberContactInfo(String id, String email, String phone)
      Updates email and phone number of a subscriber in the database.
      Parameters:
      id - The subscriber ID to update.
      email - The new email address.
      phone - The new phone number.
      Returns:
      true if the update succeeded, false otherwise.

    • isSubscriberInActiveParking

      public static String isSubscriberInActiveParking(String subscriberId)
      Checks if the given subscriber ID has an active parking record.
      Parameters:
      subscriberId - The ID of the subscriber to check.
      Returns:
      "HAS ACTIVE PARKING" if found, otherwise "NO ACTIVE PARKING"

    • getHistoryForSubscriber

      public static List<ParkingHistory> getHistoryForSubscriber(String subscriberId)
      Retrieves the parking history records for a specific subscriber. This method queries the parking_history table in the database using the provided subscriber ID, and constructs a list of ParkingHistory objects representing the subscriber's past parking sessions.
      Parameters:
      subscriberId - The ID of the subscriber whose history is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of ParkingHistory objects for the given subscriber. If no records are found or an error occurs, an empty list is returned.

    • getReservationsForSubscriber

      public static List<Reservation> getReservationsForSubscriber(String subscriberId)
      Retrieves all existing reservations for a specific subscriber. This method queries the reservations table in the database using the given subscriber ID and constructs a list of Reservation objects that represent each scheduled parking reservation. Dates and times are parsed explicitly to avoid time zone conversion issues.
      Parameters:
      subscriberId - The ID of the subscriber whose reservations are requested.
      Returns:
      A list of Reservation objects for the specified subscriber. If the subscriber has no reservations or an error occurs, an empty list is returned.

    • processPickupRequest

      public static String processPickupRequest(String parkingCode)
      Processes a pickup request based on parking code. This method performs the following steps: 1. Checks if an active parking exists for the provided parking code. - If found, the parking session is finalized, recorded in `parking_history`, and removed from `active_parkings`. - Returns "SUCCESS". 2. If not found in active_parkings, checks if the vehicle was towed (`towed_vehicles`). - If found, calculates the late duration in minutes, records it in `parking_history`, removes the entry from `towed_vehicles`, and returns "SENT_TOWED_VEHICLE_MSG". 3. If not found in either, returns "FATAL_ERROR".
      Parameters:
      parkingCode - The parking code to process.
      Returns:
      Result string indicating outcome ("SUCCESS", "SENT_TOWED_VEHICLE_MSG", or "FATAL_ERROR").

    • moveReservationToActive

      public static String moveReservationToActive(String parkingCode)
      Processes a reservation check-in request by validating the reservation timing and either moving it to active parking or returning a status indicating the next step. This method performs the following steps: 1. Checks if a reservation exists for the given parking code. 2. If found, checks whether the current time is more than 15 minutes before the scheduled entry time. - If yes, the reservation is considered too early and the method returns "ARRIVE_EARLY". 3. If the timing is valid, a new record is inserted into the active_parkings table with current timestamps. 4. Updates the parking spot status to 'occupied' and removes the reservation.
      Parameters:
      parkingCode - The reservation code entered by the user.
      Returns:
      "SUCCESS" if the reservation is activated, "ARRIVE_EARLY" if the user arrived too early (more than 15 minutes before reservation), "INVALID_CODE" if no reservation was found, or "ERROR" if an exception occurred during the process.

    • updateParkingSpotStatus

      public static void updateParkingSpotStatus(int parkingSpot, String newStatus)
      Updates the status of a parking spot in the parking_spots table.
      Parameters:
      parkingSpot - The spot number to update.
      newStatus - The new status to assign (e.g., "available", "reserved", "occupied").

    • cancelReservation

      public static void cancelReservation(String parkingCode)
      Deletes a reservation from the reservations table based on the provided parking code.
      Parameters:
      parkingCode - The parking code of the reservation to delete.

    • checkLogin

      public static boolean checkLogin(String ID, String code)
      Verifies the login credentials of a subscriber against the database. This method checks whether there exists a subscriber in the database whose subscriber_id and subscription_code match the given input. It uses a prepared SQL statement to prevent SQL injection.
      Parameters:
      ID - the subscriber's ID to authenticate
      code - the subscriber's subscription code
      Returns:
      true if the credentials are valid and a match is found in the database, false otherwise or if a database error occurs

    • checkLoginManagement

      public static String checkLoginManagement(String username, String password)
      Verifies management login credentials and retrieves the user's role from the database. This method checks whether a user with the given username and password exists in th employees table. If found, it returns the user's role ("manager" or "attendant") as a lowercase string. Otherwise, it returns null. The query uses a prepared statement to prevent SQL injection attacks.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the employee attempting to log in
      password - the password of the employee
      Returns:
      the employee's role in lowercase if the credentials are valid; null otherwise

    • getAvailableSpots

      public static List<String> getAvailableSpots()
      Retrieves a list of currently available parking spots from the database. This method queries the parking_spots table for all spots where status = 'available', formats each result into a user-friendly string, and returns the list.
      Returns:
      a list of formatted strings describing each available parking spot; if none are available or a database error occurs, returns an empty list

      Returns:
      total count of all parking spots

      Returns the number of available (free) parking spots.
      Returns:
      count of available spots

      public static int findAvailableSpot()
      Finds the number of the first available parking spot.
      Returns:
      spot_number or throws an error if none found

      Parameters:

      code - the generated reservation code
      entryDate - the reservation start date
      entryTime - the reservation start time
      exitDate - the reservation end date
      exitTime - the reservation end time
      spotNumber - the parking spot to reserve

    • searchActiveParkingByMemberId

      public static List<ActiveParking> searchActiveParkingByMemberId(int subscriberId)
      Searches for active parking records by subscriber ID. Retrieves all active parking records from the database where the given subscriber ID matches and the expected exit date is today or later.
      Parameters:
      subscriberId - The subscriber ID to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of ActiveParking records matching the search criteria.

    • searchActiveParkingBySpot

      public static List<ActiveParking> searchActiveParkingBySpot(String spot)
      Searches for active parking records by parking spot. Retrieves all active parking records from the database where the parking spot matches the provided value and the expected exit date is today or later.
      Parameters:
      spot - The parking spot identifier to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of ActiveParking records matching the search criteria.

    • extendParkingTime

      public static boolean extendParkingTime(ActiveParking ap)
      Extends the expected exit date and time of an active parking session by 4 hours. If the extension crosses midnight, the date is also updated accordingly. Updates the 'extended' flag to 1 in the database.
      Parameters:
      ap - The ActiveParking object representing the active session to be extended.
      Returns:
      true if the update succeeded, false otherwise.

    • reservationExists

      public static boolean reservationExists(String subscriberId, LocalDate entryDate, LocalTime entryTime)
      Checks whether a reservation already exists in the database for a given subscriber ID, entry date, and entry time. This method is used to prevent duplicate reservations at the exact same date and time for the same subscriber. It queries the "reservations" table and returns true if such a reservation exists.
      Parameters:
      subscriberId - The ID of the subscriber attempting to create a reservation.
      entryDate - The date of the requested reservation entry.
      entryTime - The time of the requested reservation entry.
      Returns:
      true if a reservation already exists for the given subscriber at the specified date and time, false otherwise.

    • createNewActiveParking

      public static String createNewActiveParking(Subscriber subscriber)
      Creates a new active parking entry for a subscriber who arrives without a prior reservation. This method performs the following steps: - Checks if the subscriber already has an active parking record. - Searches for the first available parking spot. - Generates a unique parking code based on subscriber ID and parking spot. - Ensures the generated parking code does not collide with existing codes. - Calculates entry and expected exit times (current time + 4 hours). - Inserts a new record into the active_parkings table. - Updates the parking_spots table to mark the selected spot as occupied.
      Parameters:
      subscriber - The subscriber attempting to create a new parking entry.
      Returns:
      - "CAR_ALREADY_PARKED" if the subscriber already has an active parking session. - "NO_SPOTS_AVAILABLE" if there are no available parking spots. - "SUCSESSFUL_PARKING" followed by the generated parking code if insertion succeeded. - "ERROR" if an exception occurred during processing.

    • generateParkingCode

      public static String generateParkingCode(String subscriberId, int parkingSpot)
      Generates a unique parking code for a new active parking entry. The generated code is built from: - The subscriber ID. - The selected parking spot number. - A random component to help avoid collisions. - A hash function is used to mix the input values into a consistent 4-digit code. Final format: "BPARKxxxx" where xxxx is a 4-digit number.
      Parameters:
      subscriberId - The ID of the subscriber requesting the parking.
      parkingSpot - The allocated parking spot number.
      Returns:
      A formatted parking code string in the form "BPARKxxxx".

    • generateUniqueParkingCode

      public static String generateUniqueParkingCode(String subscriberId, int parkingSpot)
      Generates a unique parking code by combining subscriber ID and parking spot number, ensuring the generated code does not already exist in either the reservations or active_parkings tables. The method repeatedly calls generateParkingCode and verifies uniqueness by checking against both reservations and active parkings until a valid, unused code is created.
      Parameters:
      subscriberId - The ID of the subscriber requesting the reservation or parking.
      parkingSpot - The number of the allocated parking spot.
      Returns:
      A unique parking code in the format "BPARKxxxx".

    • reservationCodeExists

      public static boolean reservationCodeExists(String code)
      Checks whether a given parking code already exists in the reservations table.
      Parameters:
      code - The parking code to check for existence.
      Returns:
      true if the code exists in the reservations table, false otherwise.

    • activeParkingCodeExists

      public static boolean activeParkingCodeExists(String code)
      Checks whether a given parking code already exists in the active_parkings table.
      Parameters:
      code - The parking code to check for existence.
      Returns:
      true if the code exists in the active_parkings table, false otherwise.

    • updateReservationDateTime

      public static boolean updateReservationDateTime(int reservationId, LocalDate newDate, LocalTime newTime)
      Updates the entry and exit date/time of an existing reservation. This method modifies a reservation record in the reservations}table based on its unique reservation_id. It sets the new entry date and time, and automatically calculates the exit date and time as 4 hours after the new entry. The method uses a prepared statement for security and executes the update via DBExecutor.
      Parameters:
      reservationId - the unique ID of the reservation to update
      newDate - the new entry date (in LocalDate)
      newTime - the new entry time (in LocalTime)
      Returns:
      true if the reservation was successfully updated (a row was affected), false if no row was updated or if an SQL exception occurred

    • cancelReservationById

      public static boolean cancelReservationById(int reservationId)
      Cancels a reservation by its ID. This method deletes the reservation from the `reservations` table and, if successful, updates the corresponding parking spot's status to 'available'.
      Parameters:
      reservationId - the ID of the reservation to cancel
      Returns:
      true if the cancellation and spot update were successful, false otherwise

    • getFutureReservations

      public static List<Reservation> getFutureReservations()
      Retrieves all future reservations from the database. A future reservation is one where the entry date and time are after the current system timestamp.
      Returns:
      A list of Reservation objects representing upcoming reservations.

    • getActiveParkings

      public static List<ActiveParking> getActiveParkings()
      Retrieves all currently active parking records from the database. Each record includes entry and expected exit details, along with the subscriber and spot information.
      Returns:
      A list of ActiveParking objects representing active parkings.

    • getSiteActivityData

      public static List<String> getSiteActivityData()
      Retrieves current active parking sessions and upcoming reservations from the database.
      Returns:
      A list of formatted strings representing active parking and future reservation records.

    • checkAndTowVehicles

      public static void checkAndTowVehicles()
      Checks for overstayed vehicles in the parking lot and processes towing actions accordingly. This method scans the active_parkings table and selects all vehicles that have exceeded their allowed parking time based on whether they extended their parking: Vehicles with {extended = TRUE} are towed after 8 hours (480 minutes). Vehicles with {extended = FALSE} are towed after 4 hours (240 minutes). For each such vehicle: - It is inserted into the towed_vehicles table. - It is removed from active_parkings. - The associated parking spot is marked as available. - If an email is available: - If this is the third late incident, a combined towing + late charge email is sent. - Otherwise, a towing notice email is sent. - The subscriber's late_count is incremented by 1. If late_count was already 2 (i.e., this is the third late incident), a late charge is applied and late_count is reset to 0. This method is intended to run periodically as part of a scheduled task.
      Parameters:
      none - This is a static method and does not receive any parameters.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during any query or update.
      RuntimeException - if unexpected errors occur in the database logic or email sending.

    • finalizeTowedVehiclesLateTime

      public static void finalizeTowedVehiclesLateTime()
      Finalizes towed vehicles that were not picked up within 24 hours.

      This method performs the following: 1. Selects all vehicles from `towed_vehicles` where `towed_at` is more than 24 hours ago. 2. For each such vehicle: - Inserts a record into `parking_history` with a fixed `late_duration` of 1440 minutes (24 hours). - Deletes the vehicle from `towed_vehicles`. - Marks the associated parking spot as 'available'.

      This method is intended to run periodically (e.g. every minute) as part of the background scheduled tasks. It ensures that vehicles left in the trailer area for too long are automatically finalized in the system.

      Parameters:
      none - Static method – no parameters required.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
      RuntimeException - if an unexpected error occurs during the process.

    • getOverlappingReservationCount

      public static int getOverlappingReservationCount(LocalDate date, LocalTime startTime, int durationHours)
      Calculates the number of existing reservations that overlap with a given time range. The time range starts at the specified date and startTime, and extends for the given duration. This method accounts for reservations that cross over midnight into the next day.
      Parameters:
      date - The date of the requested reservation start.
      startTime - The time of the requested reservation start.
      durationHours - The duration (in hours) of the reservation + potential extension (usually 8).
      Returns:
      The number of overlapping reservations found within the specified time window.

    • removeExpiredReservations

      public static void removeExpiredReservations()
      Removes expired reservations from the system and frees up the associated parking spots. A reservation is considered expired if its scheduled entry time is more than 15 minutes in the past and the vehicle has not yet arrived. For each expired reservation: - The reservation is deleted from the reservations table. - The associated parking spot is marked as 'available' in the `parking_spots` table. This method is intended to be run periodically by a scheduler, ensuring that abandoned reservations do not block future bookings.

    • generateAndStoreParkingDurationReport

      public static void generateAndStoreParkingDurationReport()
      Generates and stores a monthly parking duration report for the previous month. This method performs the following steps: Queries the parking_history table to calculate daily totals for: actual parking duration (in minutes),late duration,extended duration grouped by day of the month. Converts the result into a list of ParkingDurationRecord objects. Serializes the data to JSON using Gson. Inserts the report into the monthly_reports table, with report type "ParkingDuration". The method targets the *previous* calendar month and assumes all required data already exists in the parking_history table for that period. This task is usually scheduled to run at the beginning of each month as part of the controller.SchedulerController.

    • loadParkingDurationReport

      public static List<ParkingDurationRecord> loadParkingDurationReport(int year, int month)
      Loads a stored parking duration report for a specific month and year. This method queries the monthly_reports table for a report with: report_type = 'ParkingDuration', the specified year and code month. If a matching report is found, the method: Retrieves the JSON-encoded report data from the data column. Deserializes it into a list of ParkingDurationRecord objects using Gson. Returns the resulting list.
      Parameters:
      year - the year of the report to load
      month - the month of the report to load (1–12)
      Returns:
      a list of ParkingDurationRecord objects representing the report, or an empty list if no report is found or a database error occurs

    • generateAndStoreMemberStatusReport

      public static void generateAndStoreMemberStatusReport()
      Generates and stores a monthly member status report as a JSON string in the database.
      Parameters:
      year - The year for which the report is generated.
      month - The month for which the report is generated.

    • loadMemberStatusReport

      public static List<DailySubscriberCount> loadMemberStatusReport(int year, int month)
      Loads a saved member status report from the database for a specific year and month. The report is stored as JSON in the "monthly_reports" table.
      Parameters:
      year - The year of the report.
      month - The month of the report.
      Returns:
      A list of DailySubscriberCount records.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The password as a string, or null if not found or on error.

    • parkingCodeForEmail

      public static String parkingCodeForEmail(String email)
      Retrieves the parking code for an active parking session associated with a subscriber's email.
      Parameters:
      email - The subscriber's email address.
      Returns:
      The active parking code, or null if not found or on error.
